item.title: 📈Grouped Monitoring Charts in LangSmith 📈 Our latest set of monitoring features make it possible to A/B test and compare different versions of y...
item.description:
📈Grouped Monitoring Charts in LangSmith 📈

Our latest set of monitoring features make it possible to A/B test and compare different versions of your LLM application.

Simply send up metadata or tags along with your runs, then head to the monitoring section in any project…

item.title: 🤔 How do you gain confidence in your LLM-powered applications? For example, a novel use for generative AI is codegen for UIs (famously, @vercel's V...
item.description:
🤔 How do you gain confidence in your LLM-powered applications?

For example, a novel use for generative AI is codegen for UIs (famously, @vercel's V0), but such apps can be tricky to evaluate.

One solution: a custom LangSmith evaluator that uses a vision model instead of…

item.description:
RT Aniket Maurya ⚡️
Retrieval is one of the most important component of your RAG application. 💪

After evaluating multiple tools here is how I built a Studio for search and retrieval from PDF documents. 🔽

A minimal reproducible pipeline to retrieve semantically similar documents based on the…

item.title: RT Harrison Chase: The biggest use case for LLMs is still chatbots Revamped our use case docs to focus on: 💬Chat Completions 🧠Memory 📰Retriev...
item.description:
RT Harrison Chase
The biggest use case for LLMs is still chatbots

Revamped our use case docs to focus on:

💬Chat Completions
🧠Memory
📰Retrieval


LangChain: 💬 Chatbot use cases 💬

Chatbots are one of the most popular use cases for LLMs.

We've just overhauled our docs on how to build them!

Learn about conversational retrieval, tool usage, memory/chat history management, and more. The examples are composed with LCEL and have full…

item.title: ✒️Question Answering with Citations When building a chatbot over documents, it's often useful to ask it to cite it's sources. This can help build tr...
item.description:
✒️Question Answering with Citations

When building a chatbot over documents, it's often useful to ask it to cite it's sources. This can help build trust and check responses

We've recently added a detailed guide on how to do this!

Guide: https://python.langchain.com/docs/use_cases/question_answering/citations
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Harrison Chase: Congrats to the Exa (prev. Metaphor) team on the launch! In case you missed it - @eyfriis put together an awesome end-to-end exampl...
item.description:
RT Harrison Chase
Congrats to the Exa (prev. Metaphor) team on the launch!

In case you missed it - @eyfriis put together an awesome end-to-end example of using LangChain + LangSmith + LangServe + Exa to build a web RAG chatbot

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dA1cHGACXCo


Sarah Chieng: AIs need powerful access to knowledge. But search engines haven't improved since 1998.

- https://Exa.ai 2024

item.description:
RT Austin Vance
🚨 New Tutorial Alert 🚨 Part 2 of Chat With Your PDF

Use @typescript @LangChainAI @tailwindcss and @reactjs to build a full frontend for LangServe

- Send retrieved documents to the frontend
- Handle streaming output like ChatGPT
- Download source files

https://youtu.be/xFWllDS6ZRw

item.description:
🛒 Open Source Shopping Agent 🤖

Check out this new shopping-assistant template from @ioniccommerce.

Using our OpenAI tools agent as a base, this straightforward agent scours the web for deals related to your query!

item.title: RT Jacob Lee: 🖼️ Vision-based eval example 🖼️ Custom evaluators in @LangChainAI’s LangSmith are powerful! This notebook visually evaluates a ...
item.description:
RT Jacob Lee
🖼️ Vision-based eval example 🖼️

Custom evaluators in @LangChainAI’s LangSmith are powerful!

This notebook visually evaluates a chain that generates webpages. It renders output HTML with Puppeteer, then passes the image to @OpenAI GPT-4V for scoring:

https://github.com/langchain-ai/langsmith-cookbook/blob/main/typescript-testing-examples/vision-evals/vision-evals.ipynb

item.title: RT Yohan Lasorsa: Re @Azure AI Search has finally landed into @LangChainAI 🎉 It includes full support for Hybrid search and Semantic reranker, RAG ...
item.description:
RT Yohan Lasorsa
Re @Azure AI Search has finally landed into @LangChainAI 🎉

It includes full support for Hybrid search and Semantic reranker, RAG is now easier than ever on Azure with LangChain.js! 🦜🔗
And we'll continue improving it, send us your feedback 🙂

https://github.com/langchain-ai/langchainjs/pull/4044

item.description:
RT James Pog
guys.. its kind of working finally?!

The idea: the ultimate autonomous web scraper, that can scrape any information from any website using a combination of Playwright, GPT-4, and GPT-4 Vision.

Here's how it works

I'm using a @LangChainAI agent as the decision maker, and as an…
